title: Strictly's Catherine Tyldesley steps out with pro partner Johannes Radebe
text:
They wowed the Strictly Come Dancing judges with their Rumba to Shallow from A Star Is Born over the weekend.

And Catherine Tyldesley and her professional dance partner Johannes Radebe looked like the perfect pairing when they left It Takes Two filming in central London on Monday night.

The star, 36, looked incredible in a patterned dress as she headed off home, going arm-in-arm with her nimble partner.

Stepping out: Catherine Tyldesley and her professional dance partner Johannes Radebe looked like the perfect pairing when they left It Takes Two filming in central London on Monday night

Catherine showcased her svelte physique in the green and cream frock, displaying the results of her intense training.

The tiger print frock was teamed with strappy heels and a simple shoulder bag.

She wore her brunette locks pinned in a tight bun and matched her eye shadow to the accents on her outfit.

Stunning: Catherine showcased her svelte physique in the green and cream frock, displaying the results of her intense training

Catherine wowed with her latest routine on Saturday night, as she was told by the judges it was her 'best dance yet' after performing a sultry Rumba.

Shirley was teary-eyed after the soap star finished the routine, and said: 'I'm actually a little bit overwhelmed because normally rumbas at this time of the year makes me cringe but that was absolutely beautiful.'

Bruno went on to say that Catherine's 'star is rising' in the competition, and said that her performance was her 'breakthrough dance' of the season.

Star performers: The delighted the judges with their take on the Rumba tduring Saturday's episode of Strictly

While Craig did have some criticisms of the performance, he did admitted that it was her best dance, and she was 'absolutely stunning.'

The dancing pair were rewarded with 32, coming fourth on the leader board, and Catherine burst into tears after hearing the judge's verdict.

Catherine has come on leaps and bounds since her first performance, where they scored a combined score of 19.

Catherine scored a respectable 20 points out of 40 for her first dance but struggled to overcome her motion sickness when dancing a Viennese Waltz to I Got You Babe by Sonny and Cher.
description: Catherine Tyldesley and her professional dance partner Johannes Radebe looked like the perfect pairing when they left It Takes Two filming in central London on Monday night.
